timeline.summary: Bennu is a carbon-rich near‑Earth asteroid and the target of NASA’s OSIRIS‑REx sample‑return mission. Use this track to visualize Bennu’s heliocentric orbit and contextualize the OSIRIS‑REx rendezvous and sampling campaign.

stages.name: Discovery (1999 RQ36)
stages.text: The LINEAR survey discovers the asteroid, initially designated 1999 RQ36.

stages.name: Named Bennu (student contest)
stages.text: The asteroid receives the name “Bennu” following a student naming contest.

stages.name: OSIRIS‑REx arrives at Bennu
stages.text: NASA’s OSIRIS‑REx spacecraft arrives at Bennu and begins detailed survey and mapping operations.

stages.name: Sample collection (TAG)
stages.text: OSIRIS‑REx performs a touch‑and‑go maneuver and collects a sample from Bennu’s surface.

stages.name: Sample capsule delivered to Earth
stages.text: OSIRIS‑REx delivers a sample capsule containing material from Bennu to Earth (sample return milestone).
